titleInfo.title: R U N A W A Y.

mods.abstract: R U N A W A Y . WAS committed to the jail of this parish, a negro man, Asa, American negro; says he belongs to James Crawford, Thibodeauville, on Bayou Lafourche, four miles from Terrebonne station. Said negro is near 6 feet high, is very black, and wears beard; aged about 26 years. The owner is requested to come forward, pay charges, and take them out of jail. M. AGUILLAR, Jailor. Pointe Coupee, May 21st, 1859.

detail.title: Pointe Coupee Democrat. : (False River [i.e. New Roads], Parish of Pointe Coupee [La.]) 1858-1882

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
